metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: When you have many choices, using match is easier than writing lots of if...else .
content.html: When you have many choices, using match is easier than writing lots of if...else.

content.text: match is used to select one of many code blocks to be executed:
content.html: match is used to select one of many code blocks to be executed:

content.code_html:
fn main() {
  let day = 4;

  match day {
    1 => println!("Monday"),
    2 => println!("Tuesday"),
    3 => println!("Wednesday"),
    4 => println!("Thursday"),
    5 => println!("Friday"),
    6 => println!("Saturday"),
    7 => println!("Sunday"),
    _ => println!("Invalid day."),
  }
}

content.text: You can match multiple values at once using the | operator (OR):
content.html: You can match multiple values at once using the | operator (OR):

content.code_html:
fn main() {
  let day = 6;

  match day {
    1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 => println!("Weekday"),
    6 | 7 => println!("Weekend"),
    _ => println!("Invalid day"),
  }
}

content.text: Just like if , match can also return a value:
content.html: Just like if, match can also return a value:

content.text: This means you can save the result of a match into a variable:
content.html: This means you can save the result of a match into a variable:

content.code_html:
fn main() {
  let day = 4;

  let result = match day {
    1 => "Monday",
    2 => "Tuesday",
    3 => "Wednesday",
    4 => "Thursday",
    5 => "Friday",
    6 => "Saturday",
    7 => "Sunday",
    _ => "Invalid day.",
  };

  println!("{}", result);
}

content.text: Note: Each part of the match branches must be the same type - just like with if...else .
content.html: Note: Each part of the match branches must be the same type - just like with if...else.
